title: Is there a way to make child folders inherit their retention policy from the parent folder?
content:
I would like to be able to set a retention policy on top (parent) folder and have all the folders below it inherit that policy. Is this doable with Thunderbird? It would also be helpful to be able to turn off inheritance in a child folder if desired.

Thank you Steven Wheeler

creator: ileblanc8

title: No panes will resize at all in the classic view
content:
Here on Debian 12 with Thunderbird 128.5.0esr, it has become impossible to resize any of the elements in the classic view. I expect that hovering the mouse over the dividers between the various panes will change the pointer type and let me push the dividing lines up and down, or side to side. That just doesn't happen.

Actually, the problem is not limited to the classic view. Resizing anything has just quit working in any and all viewing layouts offered by Thunderbird.

There are some related threads here where people use custom CSS to work around limitations on what proportions can eventually be chosen. That's not my problem. I cannot make _any changes at all_. In the classic view, the pane in which the message text appears is uncomfortably small, but I can see several dozen message subject lines.

The behaviour is the same when I start Thunderbird in safe mode. Are there other non-destructive things worth trying? Thanks.
creator: mathlover

title: Emails in Inbox prior to Nov 9th not able to be read.
content:
Two computers, Thunderbird 115 and 133 on Kubuntu Linux 22.04 and 24.04 accessing the same mail folder on NAS.

I have had considerable trouble with Thunderbird snap and networking. I have now de-snapped and installed the binary.

Some mails in my Inbox appear to be there but are unable to be read. This is all emails prior to 9th November 2024. All other emails are accessible, in Archives and Sent folders, including those prior to that date - it is only the Inbox emails. The data appears to be there - the Size column shows the size correctly - and Status is displayed. When I open an email I get a completely blank Tab and yet all the info is shown in Table view - Subject, From and Date for each email is displayed correctly. They also show blank in the viewing pane.

Emails after 8th November are all displayed correctly. These emails go back many years and are important to me

Any help appreciated.
creator: r.i.p1987

title: Sending email does not work with Office365 SMTP
content:
During November my Thunderbird client 128.5.1esr (and the previous release too) stop sending email with my employer Office365 account. I can download email (IMAP) but not send email. I get the following window after a few seconds (see screenshot below): 

          Login to account "Microsoft 365" failed           Login to server smtp.office365.com with username XXXXX failed. 
          [ Enter New Password ]               [ Cancel ]. [ Retry ]

The password is correct but if I try to Enter a New Password, nothing happens. Retry displays the same window again. I see that many people had this problem in the past and I have tried all possible solutions to no avail (configuration is correct, deleting and creating the account again, etc.).
creator: rbaeza

title: Thrash folder deletes messages
content:
Hi,

I have a problem with 2 different email accounts, where the thrash folder deletes messages. Settings are set to "Don't delete any messages" on both accounts. Looks like 30 days or older messages get deleted, but I haven´t found any setting that would do this, not on Thunderbird and not on the server.

I have also asked if the problem might be on the server hosting the webmail, but they haven't found any issues with their settings so far. They are still trying to solve if there is a problem on their end, I hope :) Both accounts are on the same webmail hosting service, and the messages have been deleted from the Thunderbird desktop version and from the webmail server.

Is there anything I could do or check on my side ?

Thank you for your help in advance!

Best Regards Niko
creator: niko.karjunen
